DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine feasibility efficacy behavioral intervention , deliver exist social networking website ( Facebook ) , physical activity ( moderate-intensity minute per week ) among young adult cancer survivor compare self-help education condition . For research study , investigator conduct 12-week randomized trial . After baseline survey , weekly message , pedometer , goal-setting tool , physical activity log discussion prompt deliver intervention group . Comparison group participant receive link websites self-help education material . After 12 week , follow-up survey give group . Changes physical activity , quality life psychosocial factor examine . The investigator hypothesize receive intervention improve physical activity behavior 12-week follow-up relative comparison group .
DOC.brief_title: Facebook-based Physical Activity Intervention Young Adult Cancer Survivors : FITNET Randomized Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: Young adult age 2139 diagnose cancer ( exclude nonmelanoma skin cancer ) age 18 old At least 1 year beyond date diagnosis evidence progressive disease second primary cancer Completed cancer treatment Englishspeaking write No preexist medical condition ( ) contraindication preclude adherence unsupervised exercise program , include cardiovascular disease , congestive heart failure , pulmonary condition , renal disease , severe orthopedic condition Not adhere American Cancer Society 's recommendation least 150 minute moderateintensity exercise per week ( < 150 minutes/week ) Have access Internet service active Facebook account Willing randomize Have indicate consent check `` yes '' online consent form NonEnglish speaking < 21 > 39 year age Diagnosed cancer less one year previously still treatment Preexisting medical condition ( ) preclude adherence unsupervised exercise program , include cardiovascular disease , congestive heart failure , pulmonary condition , renal disease , severe orthopedic condition
